revised_title: Resonance and Wave Amplification in a Circular Harbour
tldr: This study investigates the wave amplitude inside a circular harbour affected by incident waves and the resonance frequencies. The author applies a rigorous mathematical treatment to a circular harbour with a small entrance and finds that the magnitude of resonance due to a single frequency increases slowly (logarithmically) as the harbour entrance decreases in size. The results agree with the work of J. Miles and the problem is equivalent to a two-dimensional sound-wave problem.
